details.description: Contact the benefit enquiry line for help and advice with making a claim if you are disabled or a carer
details.alternative_title: Contact the benefit enquiry line for help and advice
details.body:
Get advice and information on the benefits you can claim if you’re disabled or you’re a carer.

The person taking your call will be able to give you general advice. They won’t have your personal claims information.

Benefit enquiry line

Freephone: 0800 882 200
Textphone: 0800 243 355
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm

Before you call, learn more about financial help if you’re disabled.

If you have a query about a claim you’ve already made, contact the Disability benefits helpline for Disability Living Allowance or Attendance Allowance.

details.description: Includes Disability Living Allowance, Community Care Grants and Employment and Support Allowance
Attendance Allowance is money to help pay for your personal care if you're older or disabled - what you'll get, eligibility, apply, claim form AA1A
Disability Living Allowance (DLA) is a tax-free benefit for disabled children and adults - what you'll get, eligibility, applying, Personal Independence Payment
The full range of help available - benefits, allowances, Motability, vehicle tax, housing costs, TV Licence, Council Tax
Contact information for Disability Living Allowance and Attendance Allowance claim queries
